exceptions.exn: [Focus] Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
p: X -> Prop

Goal:
decidable p <-> inhabited (forall x : X, dec (p x))

Premises:
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
Inductive inhabited (A : Type) : Prop := inhabits : A -> inhabited A Arguments inhabited _%type_scope Arguments inhabits [A]%type_scope
decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> bool, decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
dec_decidable' : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> {f : X -> bool | forall x : X, p x < -> f x = true}
inhabited_sig_to_exists : inhabited {x : ?A | ?P x} -> exists x : ?A, ?P x where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> Prop |- Type] ?P : [X : Type p : X -> Prop |- ?A -> Prop]
exists_to_inhabited_sig : (exists x : ?A, ?P x) -> inhabited {x : ?A | ?P x} where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> Prop |- Type] ?P : [X : Type p : X -> Prop |- ?A -> Prop]
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
iff_dec : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> dec (X <-> Y)
Dec : forall X : Prop, dec X -> dec X
impl_dec : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> dec (X -> Y)
and_dec : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> dec (X /\ Y)
or_dec : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> dec (X \/ Y)
not_dec : forall X : Prop, dec X -> dec (~ X)
dec_DM_impl : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X -> Y) -> X /\ ~ Y
dec_DN : forall X : Prop, dec X -> ~ ~ X -> X
dec_DM_and : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X /\ Y) -> ~ X \/ ~ Y
False_eq_dec = fun x : False => match x as f return (forall y : False, dec (f = y)) with end : eq_dec False
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
Dec_auto : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), X -> is_true (Dec X)
Dec_reflect : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), is_true (Dec X) < -> X
dec_transfer : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> dec P -> dec Q
prod_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Type), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
RingMicromega.PolEnv = fun R : Type => Env.Env R : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.PolEnv _%type_scope
sum_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X + Y
prod_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X * Y
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
option_eq_dec : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec option X
list_eq_dec : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec list X
RingMicromega.NFormula = fun C : Type => (RingMicromega.PolC C * RingMicromega.Op1)%type : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.NFormula _%type_scope
sum_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Type), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sumbool_ind : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
EqType : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eqType
eqType_CS : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eqType
BinInt.Z.order_induction_0 : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Proper (eq ==> iff) A -> A BinNums.Z0 -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> A n -> A (BinInt.Z.succ n)) -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n BinNums.Z0 -> A (BinInt.Z.succ n) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n
BinInt.Z.mul_lt_mono_neg_l : forall p n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt p BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.lt n m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.mul p m) (BinInt.Z.mul p n)
BinNat.N.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt BinNums.N0 p -> BinNat.N.lt n m < -> BinNat.N.lt (BinNat.N.mul p n) (BinNat.N.mul p m)
BinInt.Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 p -> BinInt.Z.lt n m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.mul p n) (BinInt.Z.mul p m)
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
ZMicromega.max_var = fix max_var (jmp : BinNums.positive) (p : EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z) {struct p} : BinNums.positive := match p with | EnvRing.Pc _ => jmp | EnvRing.Pinj j p0 => max_var (BinPos.Pos.add j jmp) p0 | EnvRing.PX p0 _ q => BinPos.Pos.max (max_var jmp p0) (max_var (BinPos.Pos.succ jmp) q) end : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol BinNums.Z -> BinNums.positive Arguments ZMicromega.max_var _%positive_scope
dec2bool : forall P : Prop, dec P -> bool
option_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : option A -> Type), (forall a : A, P (Some a)) -> P None -> forall o : option A, P o

```coq
intros dec_p.
split.
- intros. apply exists_to_inhabited_sig. exists x. apply H.
- intros [f Hf]. exists f. intros x. apply dec_reflect. apply Hf.
Qed.```

original: intros dec_p. split. - intros. apply exists_to_inhabited_sig. exists x. apply H. - intros [f Hf]. exists f. intros x. apply dec_reflect. apply Hf.
